name: University of Salford
memberOrga: Total number of staff employed by the University is 2,106 (Financial Year 2016/17)
goal: The University of Salford is a major UK University located in the North West of England serving the people of Greater Manchester. The University was granted its Royal Charter in 1967 and currently has approximately 20,000 students. The University has major strengths in Science, Engineering, Health studies, Design, Media and Urban studies. The University is involved in a number of national and international partnerships. The University has charitable status exempt from registration, and holds a Royal Charter and constitution as approved by the UK Parliament.
interests: Borders and Security, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, General and Institutional Affairs, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Sport, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives: The University is involved in over 20 international projects funded through a variety of programmes, including EU-funded Horizon 2020, Erasmus+ and Interreg. The University has appropriate policies in place that meets UK and EU legal requirements governing finance, equal opportunities, health and safety and disability. The University is subject to external audit in line with UK requirements (Higher Education Funding Council for England) and EU requirements in relation to EU programmes.
